notes: First run. Japan grocery category. Key lesson: Most popular Japanese products are already on Amazon US through importers or official channels. Need to focus on truly niche/regional products, or products available at 3x+ markup. Minimal Wash Muro was only discovery - compact motorized washing device not yet imported to US. Future runs should consider: 1) Less-covered regions (Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe, Latin America), 2) Products mentioned in local forums vs tourist/expat forums, 3) Products with regulatory barriers (food, supplements) or cultural specificity.

Focused on Korean personal care and cleaning products. FDA-blocked sunscreens emerged as strongest opportunity (8.7 score) due to massive demand and clear US regulatory gap. Also found Tamburins niche fragrance brand. Rejected several products now available on Amazon US (Aestura, sodium percarbonate, brass utensils).

reason: Strong competition: most Taiwan kitchen products either already on US market (Tatung, Kinmen knives, pineapple cakes, I-Mei snacks), perishable (tea eggs, beverages), too niche (ceramics, vintage items), regulated (alcohol), or have equivalent US alternatives (chopsticks, strainers)

notes: Focused on German tools and home goods. Most professional tools (Knipex, Wera, Gedore) already widely available on Amazon US. Best finds: German square pillows (hard to source), Knoppers (available but 3x markup validates demand), Hazet tools (awareness gap)

Thailand health-wellness products. High Amazon availability - most major Thai brands already have US presence. Found 2 unique products: Erb (royal court herbal underarm toner) and Rati (food-grade alum deodorant spray).

First China run - cleaning category saturated on Amazon. All candidates rejected: major brands (Roborock, Xiaomi, Tineco) already established in US; commodity items widely available; laundry detergents (Blue Moon, Liby) lack evidence of superiority over Tide/Persil despite China market leadership. Category not promising for China.

First Vietnam run. Focused on grocery/food products. Strong results: 4 discoveries including Phở Gánh instant noodles, Mắc Khén peppercorns, Sa Tế chili oil, and Ô Mai preserved fruits. Rejected 5 products already widely available on Amazon (Saigon cinnamon, Oh!Ricey pho, lotus tea, G7 coffee, artichoke tea).

First Philippines run. Strong performance on beauty/cosmetics - GRWM, Happy Skin, Detail, Colourette all unavailable on Amazon US with clear gaps vs US alternatives. Filipino beauty brands excel at humidity-proof formulas and morena skin tone matching.
First Indonesia run - focused on kitchen tools and condiments

First India run. Focus on ayurvedic personal care. Strong finds: Boroline (cult multi-purpose cream), Kama Ayurveda Kumkumadi Oil (premium miracle elixir), Vicco Vajradanti (heritage toothpaste). Rejected several products already available on Amazon US.
First Sweden run - focus on kitchen/grocery. Top discoveries: Estrella Dill Chips (7.5), OBH Nordica (7.2), Hälsans Kök (6.7)

UK kitchen products run. Major heritage brands (Mason Cash, Dualit, Simplex, Falcon, Denby) all readily available on Amazon US. Smaller artisan brands (The Art Rooms, Dog & Dome, Perkins & Morley) not on Amazon but need deeper demand validation.

Italian stationery market heavily saturated in US - major brands (Fabriano, Rossi 1931, Epica, Il Papiro, Pineider, Aurora, Leonardo, Visconti) all readily available on Amazon. Luxury fountain pens have strong US/German competitors. Category insight: traditional European stationery is well-distributed in US market.

First Netherlands exploration. Focused on health-wellness category. Many popular Dutch food products already on Amazon US (stroopwafels, hagelslag, chocomel). Found 3 viable products: vanillevla (refrigerated custard - low importability), gevulde speculaas (premium almond cookie - highest score 7.7), boerenomeletkruiden (herb mix - good importability).

First Poland exploration - focused on cleaning and personal-care products. Strong findings: BasicLab retinol (8.3), Tołpa peat extract (8.5), SIDOLUX wood cleaner (6.3). Polish skincare/dermocosmetics particularly promising.

Strong US market penetration - all validated products either on Amazon or have good US equivalents (Thayers for witch hazel, readily available baklava/honey/spices). Turkish diaspora + import infrastructure means limited arbitrage opportunity for mainstream products.
First Brazil run. Focused on personal care. Strong discoveries: Granado antiseptic powder, Episol SPF 70, O Boticario dry shampoo. Rejected Skala, Phebo, Novex, Salon Line as already on Amazon US.

key_finding: Mexican kitchen tools market saturated on Amazon US - molcajetes, molinillos, clay pots, wooden spoons all readily available from multiple sellers

notes: First Colombia run. All validated products already saturated on Amazon US. Colombian handicrafts/household items have mature import market (Chamba Imports, IMUSA brand, Bomboná, etc). Popular items: La Chamba ceramics, ruanas, tostoneras, Wayuu bags, chocolateras, Carriel bags.

First Australia run. Many top products already on Amazon US (Lanolips, Lucas Pawpaw, Thursday Plantation, Cancer Council, Sukin, Biosota, Invisible Zinc, Aesop). Found MooGoo Eczema Cream as unique discovery - strong reviews, steroid-free natural eczema treatment, has US distribution but eczema cream not on Amazon.

First Argentina run - explored multiple categories (grocery, personal-care, kitchen, home-tools, laundry-clothing). Top discoveries: Mascaras Chané wooden masks (7.7), Chaguar fiber bags (7.3), Chalteños alfajores (5.8). Many candidates already on Amazon (yerba mate products, mate gourds, rose hip oil).
